body:
Hello,

thanks for reporting this.

The namespace name is stored as a symbol (https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/blob/master/lib/active_admin/namespace.rb#L35)

So it looks like passing `where(:namespace => :admin)` generates the SQL `"active_admin_comments"."namespace" = "active_admin_comments"."admin"` instead of `"active_admin_comments"."namespace" = "admin"`.

Is that the expected behaviour or a bug in the Postgresql adapter?
This was reported before with rails 3.1 and mysql. https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/issues/103 (See the comments) So I believe this is expected behavior.
Well, I discover something new in AR today! :)
Two years later and this shitty bug show off again in master.

I'm facing the same issue, but with sqlite. Using a fresh rails app and and active_admin master branch, I get `SQLite3::SQLException: no such column: active_admin_comments.admin: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM "active_admin_comments"  WHERE "active_admin_comments"."namespace" = "active_admin_comments"."admin"`  when visiting the comments index action.

[This comment](https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/issues/103#issuecomment-1425822) is the topical one. It looks like certain DB adapters have this problem. What's weird, @marcusg, is that the Rails app that AA autobuilds for testing uses SQLite, but isn't running into this problem.

That's an issue, because it means I can't reproduce it, so I can't be sure that any given change fixes it.

Could you try changing this line?

``` diff
-            resource_class.where :namespace => name
+            resource_class.where :namespace => name.to_s
```

issue.title: AA Comment updates & bugfixes

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
- Removes old DB migration for AA comments
- Fixes #367 regression by calling `to_s` on the namespace
- Fixes #2294 by applying queries to the passed object
- disables eager load of polymorphic associations for Rails 3.0 where they don't work

body: @Daxter: using your branch from PR https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/pull/2310 fixed the problem for me. Thanks!
Cool. Once I get the failing test sorted, I'll merge the changes in.
Okay @marcusg, #2310 has been merged into master :]
